alert.note: Alert for Spencer; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 11:18AM EDT until June 29 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SPENCER AND WARRICK COUNTIES... At 1018 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain had mainly exited the area. However, additional showers and thunderstorms may impact portions of this area over the next several hours. Radar estimates indicate 3 to 4.5 inches occurred from Tennyson to Chrisney and Grandview. Water may be slow to recede across portions of this area. Flash Flooding remains likely. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Evansville, Boonville, Newburgh, Chandler, Rockport, Dale, Lynnville, Grandview, Folsomville, Eureka, Santa Claus, Elberfeld, Chrisney, Tennyson and Gentryville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
